Reviews.Title: “No frills but good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanjiv1964
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for the second time for 2 nights last week. I was impressed with the quality of the room and the food in the only restaurant they have. They have free Wifi internet which is great and asked how many devices I had and provided me with with separate access codes for my Mac and iPad at the time of check in. Brilliant! Just one thing, no one picks up at the reception or at the other extension numbers on the phone. There's a button for 'complaints' on the phone - I tried this too and got no response. Is this Marriott quality - NO. Guys, fix this!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, terrible access to the highway”
Reviews.Author: katialady
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a Deluxe room with full board package. Pros: The room was nice, quiet, with good A/C, nice bathroom, comfortable bed with good quality bedding, everything was clean. Restaurant makes passable Italian and a very good breakfast spread. The sauna was ok, pool had a bit too much chlorine. Very secure parking. Very close to several shopping malls, including an outlet mall. The staff is very professional and very Turkish. Small aside: What does "very Turkish" mean? For Turks, professionalism is not how many times you smile, but how efficient you are at the job. So yes, they don't smile, but it's just their culture. Also, in Turkish culture, if something is wrong and you want something reimbursed, you have a looong conversation with a person who is responsible for the money. Better yet, before starting this conversation you should become friends with someone who can advise this person responsible for the money. It's their culture. They won't reimburse you if you just state something is wrong or aren't polite. Cons: It's fast to get into the hotel as the entrance is just off the highway ramp. However, to get back out onto the highway, since the hotel is on a one-way street, you must do a fairly big loop around the neighbourhood. Together with the rest of Istanbul population. Google estimated 10 min, but it took us 20 min of agressive lane shuffling just to get out onto the highway. Once on the highway, it was an easy 5 min drive to the airport. Don't expect to walk around the hotel as there isn't much except the highway and a lot of cars. Slippers given in the spa are VERY slippery on their floors. So much, as to be dangerous. Take your own, or walk barefoot - much safer, even with an occasional desease you may catch ;) We saw shuttles day and night around the hotel, but can't say anything about them as we had a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Collberg
Reviews.Content: We used the Courtyard for a stopover inbetween flight. The room had a nice panoramic window and was of high standard. Very good breakfast. We took the shuttle bus back to the aiport (leaves on every full hour), but unfortunately we didnÂ´t have the patience to wait for it on the way to the hotel. This nearly killed us, we were two families that used two taxis and both taxi drivers drove like lunatics (apparantely worse than normal because the ride was so short and they were angry about getting back so soon at last position in the taxi line again). The shuttle bus leaves on the minute .30 from the airport, I recommend that you wait for it.

Reviews.Title: “Early flight out of IST”
Reviews.Author: kknb4082
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night, before a very early flight out the next morning. The shuttle runs once an hour but is punctual and sticks to the published schedule. A taxi from IST costs around 20 Lira. The property is what you would expect from a Category 3 property, clean modern with comfortable beds. They couldn't upgrade us (we are Marriott Platinum) but comped us the minibar which was a nice touch. The restaurant downstairs is incredibly expensive, you are better off walking for less then 5 minutes and getting a kebab and drink if you want food for a fraction of the price. Decent swimming pool, and spa. No jacuzzi. The hotel is directly on the takeoff path for aircrafts but excellent soundproofing of windows.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport- no surprises”
Reviews.Author: sasquatch27
Reviews.Content: Look to the internet for a good deal including a fantastic breakfast. Quick shuttle from airport no hassles with taxis. Standard Marriott rooms everything clean and modern.I was disappointed at the extra charge for internet in room and in business centre. Free wireless in lobby but it should be free in guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night whilst on business in Turkey. It is close to the airport (10mins max) which is convenient but the taxi drivers won't thank you for such a short fare. Very clean, new and nice rooms. My room was very well equipped. Bar and restaurant are expensive and I suggest you reserve the room online to get the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable stay, hunt for deals with free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: J_Arica
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is first hub on our frequent trips to Turkey. There are many nice hotels to stay in the general area. This is one. Best breakfast of them all. Be sure to check the Marriott site for offers. Lovely style, upscale and clean hotel. Nice gym, spa, pool etc. Love the bar. Good wine selection (key for me) with polite staff. Great warmed barmix.

Reviews.Title: “Positive surprise”
Reviews.Author: Geht_net_gibts_net
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out all positive. Friendly, efficient service, fantastic room nice breakfast. You need a visa, if you are a citizen of the EU, but it is worth it! I will stay there for my next regular trip to Istanbul. Be aware of the taxis at the airport, they are disgusting and try to rip you off. There is a shuttle, only once per hour and difficult to find

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stopover”
Reviews.Author: Lotfi B
Reviews.Content: Location is great, high quality at value price. Very courteous staff

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Business close to Ataturk airport”
Reviews.Author: Avargasil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fair to stay the night, if you have business close to the airport. Giving the traffic jams you may found in Istanbul this is a reason to go to this hotel. I asked a non smoking room and got one that seemed not to fit, I was not able to change it, not able to complain about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good but very expensive beer”
Reviews.Author: tonywade
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Courtyard by Marriott hotel. Clean, efficient, modern, with decent sized rooms and a reasonably fast wifi connection. The food is good and a fair amount of local dishes along with the obligatory Marriott burger. The buffet nights are the best with plenty of delicious local dishes on array to be eaten to your hearts content. The breakfast is decent and buffet style but can get really busy at certain times due to the proximity to the airport (see later). The staff are friendly, efficient and accommodating. The rooms are good but note the minibar is empty as you have to buy your fayre in the Courtyard Market just behind reception. Though it says its an Airport Hotel its not 'On' the airport. Its a mile or so north of a 2.5 mile long main runways. The free shuttle takes about 15 mins to drive to the main terminals along a very busy main road so can take longer. This is a solid hotel in the Courtyard brand the only major downside is the beer. It is prohibitively expensive when ordered at the bar and i will not be doing that again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: LaskoSanJose
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel. The room is very good and clean. But I have 6:30 am flight so I did not have much time to enjoy it. The hotel shuttle to airport is not running that early but the hotel was able to get a taxi for me ready in the early am.

Reviews.Title: “What a place !”
Reviews.Author: SpinningMax
Reviews.Content: Was in Istanbul for business and my flight was cancelled. So Turkish Airline booked me on the first available flight: the next morning. Turkish sent me to spend the night at the Courtyard. It's a cheap hotel. Clean, kind personnel, but the place is extremely cheap. I had to wake up quite early and therefore went to sleep at 10 p.m. At midnight I was woken up by a thundering voice coming from a loudspeaker, bellowing something in Turkish. Thought that perhaps the hotel was on fire: I called the receptionist to ask for an explanation: "Sorry, it was just a mistake". Bet it was ! All in all I don't feel like going back to Courtyard in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: This is not an airport hotel but they have a shuttle that takes about 20 minutes to get to the airport in the morning. Slow checkin and checkout. Very good rooms, pushing five star. Bathrooms okay. Location is a disadvantage if you do not need to be at the Halkali area. Excellent breakfast and service. Finding a taxi might be a hassle. You need to pay for parking. Your best bet in the area though. The Rennaisance might be a better option as it is right on the sea side and has many walking distance activities.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDFOttawaCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night before a very early morning flight home. The 4 am taxi was prompt and, as noted by others, is 15 TL and a short ride. Our room was lovely, quiet, and very large which is excellent for doing the big final packing. It had a great bathroom. Quality of food in the restaurant was very good. The only negatives were 1. Internet is only free in the common areas and 2. The pool area is not very inviting...poorly lit and indoors but with cool water. We would stay here again for an overnight but not longer as there is no obvious place to walk to from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Plankty
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit in Courtyard and I did enjoy. Staying in Marriott properties often, met and exceeded most of my expectations. Hotel is located 10 minutes drive from Istanbul International AP, cost 15 TL, if you couldnt catch complimentary shuttle. Hotel is clean (brand new anyway), compact but able to provide what is expected from its category. It has some 18 floors and although it is close to the AP, wouldnt hear any noise as the windows are soundproof. The room we had, had two separated queen beds, very clean, well maintained, got plenty of sunlight despite the cloudy weather in Istanbul. Staff did a good job accommodating us for short meeting we had in the hotel, responsive and courteous. Sibel at the front desk was very informative at check in, informed us about everything we needed to know. There is a mini-mart behind front desk where you can supply necessary suff you need during your stay. Workout room and indoor swimming pool are available. Well equipped gym is open 24 hours and heated indoor pool has also a tub inside open until 22hrs in the evening. Food, hmmmm, was very good. Delicious breakfast on the lobby level, again served by good people with decent smile. Overall, I liked the hotel, would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent end to our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tammb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of our vacation. The airport is easily accessible by tram/train from the main part of the city. Once reaching the airport we found the free shuttle and were taken to the hotel. The rooms are lovely - nice decor, bathrooms were very comfortable and a stunning view of the city and airstrip. We went for a swim in the huge round swimming pool - very relaxing setting. The changing facilities are good and the showers are lovely - huge rain shower faucets! We had dinner in the bistro as there does not seem to be much to walk to. The dinner was excellent and very affordable. The lobby has airport departure and arrival up to date information, taxi's come very quickly and we were not taken for a ride. The taxi ride was 15 TL. This hotel is very nice, secure and the staff are very accommodating - they really could not do enough. The shuttle runs from 7am -11pm at night I think, so if your flight is during those hours it is awesome. We would definately stay again or recommend this hotel. Price was decent for Istanbul, its new, staff, rooms and food were awesome!! A pleasure to end the holiday this way.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect it to be at the airport”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: A good quality hotel as you would expect from Marriott, but it is a good ten minute taxi trip from the airport. And, when even lowly pensions in Turkey all offer free wi-fi, it seems miserly of this hotel to charge for it. It is not as though the rooms are cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you need a place near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Kittypatrol
Reviews.Content: This is what you would expect from a Courtyard Marriott. It was clean, modern, had an airport shuttle and good breakfast. Do NOT pick this hotel as your base for exploring Istanbul, it is too far from the best city sights.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the airport”
Reviews.Author: roderrs
Reviews.Content: This is a standard issue international chain hotel. Clean, good service, reliable airport shuttle etc etc. The area around felt a bit dodgy but there is solid security. Nice food in the restaurant, minor problems at breakfast- the choice was great but the staff were clueless. It is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, but very far from anything”
Reviews.Author: airwav
Reviews.Content: the only reason you would want to stay in this hotel is proximity to the airport (15 minutes in light traffic). other than this, it is very far from anything. in good traffic (between 10 am and 3 pm) it takes you more than 2 hours to reach the center, Taksim area. typical courtyard standard-no beter or worse than other courtyards i have stayed in. the only exception would be the gym and pool, which are clean and well equiped for a 4 star. food is mediocre. i have eaten breakfast (very small choice) and dinner (much better). i would recommend eating at a nearby kebab place, Bursa kebabci, and they have very quality food, though no alcohol is served at all. service is fine, the front desk staff is helpful and polite. othervthan this, there is nothing remarcable about this hotel. i would certainly urge the owners to refurbish the exterior, that is very shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: woodtiger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two reasons: 1) it was a Marriott hotel 2) it was close to the airport but only 23km into the city Merrily thinking that it would take me 45 minutes tops to get into Istanbul for my meetings. Three hours later..... Seriously, the traffic is nonsensical. I have never encountered anything like it. When planning to go anywhere by cab, think about how long it would take to cover the same distance in the UK and quadruple it! There is a more frequent shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel and back when I stayed - it goes every hour from 06.00, and it is free. Mke use of this as a taxi from the airport to here cost me 20Turkish Lira. It wasn't cheap (I couldn't find any Marriott hotels in Istanbul that were halfway reasonable), but I figured that as a gold card holder, I would be treated with the same courtesy as the many other marriott hotels I have stayed in. No such luck! There is not even an acknowldegment here, let along anything fancypants to show their appreciation for your loyalty. I found it astonishing that at breakfast 1) no-one was pouring the fruitjuice from a station set up, so I went to help myself, only to be poinced upon and told that I would have to pay extra!!! and 2) I went to take a bottle of sparkling water to my room - there were lots lined up by the cordial that they try to pass off as fruit juice, I had drunk most of one bottle anywhat, but I was made to feel very uncomfortable when the restauarant manager told me to take my bottle back to the table. Do not expect any luxuries here - despite the cost, there are no pleasant touches. It is bog standard, with unfriendly staff. Fortuntaley I had just two nights here. I would certainly not rush back.

Reviews.Title: “decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Yechiel_L
Reviews.Content: Very clean, well kept facility. Only has shower, no bathtub. Breakfast reasonable. Does not have the irritating autobar - has minifridge which you can have stocked or you can shop yourself in the 24-hour market near reception.

Reviews.Title: “Only suitable for a stop-over”
Reviews.Author: lkarnauk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located mÄ±ddel of nowhere so suitable only if you want to stay close to airport for an early flight. Shuttle bus goes to Ataturk airport every hour that is convinient (10-15 min rÄ±de). Rooms are modern and clean yet not luxury. No slippers no bathrobe. No sign of aÄŸprecÄ±atÄ±on for Marriott Rewards elite members. Some noise from aicrtafts taking off but not really disturbing. Breakfast is poor for an Ä°stanbul hotel of such class. Charges apply for fresh juices - redÄ±culous. There is a cheap kebap house 50 from the hotel - and nothÄ±ng else.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of weasel wording in special offers”
Reviews.Author: stephencohen
Reviews.Content: We had a free one night stay courtesy of Turkish Airlines' special offer and, when we were there, noticed that the hotel was offering bed, breakfast and a one-day tour of the city for 139 Euros. We booked this on-line for an extra night in the hotel. On the morning of the tour, the one-day had shrunk and only a half-day trip round the city was being offered. Lengthy conversations with the reception staff revealed that, in Turkey, one day means half a day! Escalating the discussion with the Guest Relations Specialist and then the Rooms Operations Manager produced a satisfactory result; we got the full day tour with lunch included. The next day, we were waved goodbye by the senior staff who apologised for the error. It was all very amicable, but why did it take a half-hour of argument to receive what had been advertised and paid for? In other respects the hotel was average - the room was adequate with a small bathroom, Internet access was 8 Euros a day, and the 'American' breakfast was the same as a Holiday Inn but without any bacon. Would we stay there again? No - it is a 45 Turkish Lira fare into town (about Â£17 each way) and Turkish taxi drivers are among the worst in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: Boomer-san
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel at IST Instanbul Ataturk International Airport, it is more like a full service hotel than a traditional Courtyard. Hotel staff are extremely attentive. Everything is new, restaurant and bar very nice, good business center, service is outstanding for a Courtyard. The in-room mini bar in fridge is FREE. Beware as free airport shuttle schedule is dodgey and changes frequently. If you have to take an airport taxi to the hotel don't pay more than 10 lira.

Reviews.Title: “US-style Hotel, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: g9701
Reviews.Content: nice, clean, typically US-style rooms, stayed here for 4 hours due to a late arrival. was woken up by hotel staff at 6:00 only to tell me that the door-key is working again ?? breakfast was ok, nothing special!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: bartolino
Reviews.Content: I had a late evening flight into Istanbul International airport and decided to book my first night stay at this Marriott. Unfortunately, I missed the last free Marriott shuttle (11:30pm) and had to take a cab ride to the hotel ($12) I arrived to a welcoming front desk clerk that upgraded me to a top floor "superior room" with free access to the mini-bar, and a complimentary breakfast buffet (that was very good). I should mention that I am a Platinum awards member. The front desk clerks were more than accommodating, willing to help me with all of my requests, including helping me book a bus trip for later that week. The hotel is clean, well staffed, and with up to date furnishings. The free Wi-Fi is good with a strong signal. Bathroom has a nice compliment of soaps, shampoos and the like. They have a free "Old City" shuttle service that was fully reserved, so I took the free hourly airport shuttle and caught the subway, then transferred to the old city tram (very easy) All in all, this is an excellent hotel with great, friendly service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare overnight stay at the worst so called "International" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sabby37
Reviews.Content: Stayed with overnight at this this so called "international" hotel. Summary of our (My Mum 75 years old, My wife, my son 17 years and myslef) overnight stay: 1) Arrive at mid-night by taxi at the hotel. The advertised hotel shuttle bus from the aiport stops at 11:00 pm but of course nobdoy had informed us. (Main reason why we had booked this hotel with its proxmity to the airport and hassle free shuttle bus !!) 2) Takes the junior clerk 25 mins to check us in 3) There are no porters/bell-boys at the this hotel since " it is not courtyard policy", so we were told. So ended up dragging 4 heavy cases into the reception and our rooms 4) Electric cards not operating when we got there due to a system failure. These cards are needed for the lifts and the doors to the guest rooms. So basically we ended waiting in our rooms with the doors open whilst trying to determine what we should do next. (We were very lucky to get to our room on 12th floor, thanks to the pity shown to us by the security man at the hotel, who happened to be there ) 5) There are no 24 hour room service. It stopped at 1 am. So by the time we were ready to ask for a small bite to eat, it was too late. 6) Alarm called booekd for 09:00 am the next day went off at 07:00 am instead. I never found out why ! 7)The free WiFi offered to us at the time of the check-in was disputed at check-out as the lovely clerk had forgotten to recors her kind offer in the SYSTEM.. I do travel all over th global thanks to my job and have stayed at number of hotel Hotels in Istanbul previoulsy. Take my word for it. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “could be better...”
Reviews.Author: ArancinoNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, July 29 2011. Upon arrival, I had to load my own (heavy) luggage through the x-ray machine which was about a meter off the ground. Security people watched nonchalantly as I struggled and snickered when I asked about bell boys or door men. While I managed, I would hate to see an elderly couple or a pregnant woman have to trough the same ordeal. At check-in I complained to the evening manager on duty, who promptly offered to upgrade us, and give free wifi and minibar access, while promising this would not happen again. The minibar consisted of a can of beer and three cans of soft drinks and a small toblerone candy bar - gee wiz! And wifi did not work. when I called the front desk, an amiable lady told me that the "first room" on all floors is known to have very poor internet availability. Why upgrade me to a room with no workable internet connection when I specifically inquired about wifi?? After further complaining, I was offered to move rooms, but as it was already past midnight, I passed. Finally, someone offered to just let us use a room with wifi without moving - while helpful, we passed and went to sleep. Room was nice, modern and clean. Bed was comfortable and bathroom functional. Hotel a quick 5-10 min drive from the airport. Too bad about the service...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for airport layover”
Reviews.Author: Lhotse21
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Courtyards seem to be great little places for airport layovers and this one is no exception. It is brand new, very clean and quite attractive and roomy. They had a great breakfast in the morning, helpful staff and all the ammenities. We stayed there for an overnight flight to Cyprus from Kiev, so I don't know about how close or far downtown Istanbul and its sites are. I spent three weeks in Turkey before, so we were not interested in going downtown, but I would imagine it would be a ways, so I can't comment on that. But as far as being close to the airport, it's great. I would stay there again and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to someone else. We had a very pleasant stay and no negatives. It was very quiet and we had a good restful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but Crowded and Depressing”
Reviews.Author: ruhskis
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it had shuttle service both to the airport and to central Istanbul. We were only in the city for two days en route to our flight home and wanted be able to do a little sightseeing before leaving. The price was right,the shuttle service to the city worked well for us (required us to spend the entire day in town because there was only one pick up and delivery time, but that was ok with us), our room was comfortable and the breakfast (included) was abundant,. However, it was definitely a business hotel, noisy and crowded with resultant overworked staff and poor service. The neighborhood in which the hotel was located was quite industrial and depressing, definitely would have been frightening to leave the gated and guarded compound of the hotel. The staff even checked under the shuttle bus with mirrors for what one must assume would be bombs. Overall, this hotel works for a stop in Istanbul and convenience to the airport, but I'm sure I could have found other places with shuttle service that were in a more pleasant environment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for one night layover”
Reviews.Author: humbleinla
Reviews.Content: Close to airport, free pickup. Outstanding breakfast. Actually, the breakfast is better than Amira Hotel which is rated number one on this site. I stay at Amira for 5 nights so I do know both hotels pretty well. This is not the place to stay if you want to be close to all the sights, but a perfect place for layover.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far”
Reviews.Author: Observer1972
Reviews.Content: I know in advance that the hotel is far from the city center, but I expect that the services the hotel and the luxury Marriott will be a substitute for the road long exhausting, when we received the rooms we stayed more than an hour, and when I asked that that not be room-related, and found that the chamber is connected, I went back and asked for time change the other room, but the employee gave us connecting rooms as well, and then we came back again and asked to change room?? Breakfast is simple, annoying and a crowded restaurant. Hotel bus service is limited, about 4 hours you will not find the bus at the airport When you want to move to the downtown area shows that the bus fully booked The cost of the taxi are very expensive I will not repeat the experience of the Marriott Courtyard again

Reviews.Title: “Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: blackford1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night on a twelve hour layover. We got lucky and arrived at the airport at the right time and got the shuttle to the airport without having to wait. Was told at check-in that the shuttle would take us back to the airport early (4:30am) the next morning, but upon checking out we were informed that the shuttle was not running and so we would have to take a taxi at our own expense. Other than that, the experience was fine. The room was clean, and had good amenities. This hotel is not near anything of interest to a tourist, so it's really only good for people in transit, and it was fine for that.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: alex1234Paris
Reviews.Content: Hi guys,just got back from Istanbul.Our stay at Courtyard was not a very pleasurable one.First of all,the hotel is actually on the opposite site of the airport frm the city.So,what they say on the Marriott site is a lie.....those 15 km from the center are actually 27.....The location is as bad as it gets.....the hotel is opposite a gas station and some abandoned warehouses.The hotel is a typical Courtyard in every respect but for the quality of services and the price.A deluxe double can cost up to 190 Euro.....The Courtyard in Vienna,for example,located next to Schonbrunn Imperial Palace is 80 Euro/night.... There are no bus stations or underground(Metro) in the area,so you are left with only 2 possibilities:either you use the taxi,which will cost you 50 Euro one wayto Center and take 1 1/2 hours,or you can use the Complimentary shuttle service to the airport which runs every hour or so,and from there take the Metro to downtown ......here comes the fun part......while going to the airport is easy enough (for the shuttle departing station is right in front of reception basically,and an be supervised by Management) the return is serously flawed....The ideea is that,if they believe they will not receive new guests at the hotel,at a certain hour,they may not send the shuttle to take you back and that means that you shall remain stranded in the airport and finally be forced to take a cab...that means 10 Euro and a crazy trip with taxi drivers who believe themselves to be Michael Schumacher,at least...... The hotel has poor front desk services,they don't care about their customers,the free internet in the Lobby is a sham,designed to force you to buy slow internet access at hefty prices, and the Market by Courtyard is a bad joke with 1 star Michelin prices . Ok,let's get pragmatic: Cleanliness: 4* Location:1* Service:2* Spa:2* Have you ever seen a Spa pool heated at 20 degrees and populated by workers from the gas station across the street?!?!?! No joke...I met theguys next day when filing my tank and they did it for me.... :( Pricing:6* considering all of the above

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dreadymeh
Reviews.Content: Stopped over night here while passing through Istanbul, the hotel is conveniently located near a main road with easy access to a couple decent malls a short taxi ride away. Had a nice dinner and the bar staff were friendly, check-in was quick despite a lot of people arriving all at once. Room was clean with good amenities, though you have to pay for the water which is a bit of a bug bear for me. Overall you can do a lot worse at other airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly acceptable hotel for a 12 hour layover”
Reviews.Author: Geddes_7
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably new hotel - its market positioning sits between a Marriott Hotel and a Courtyard. Closer to the Marriott as it has a restaurant and bar facilities. The hotel is about an 8 minute taxi ride from the airport (assuming there is no traffic congestion - which there often is in Istanbul). The hotel runs shuttles, but they are irregular and you can arrive and find a 2 hour wait for the next shuttle. A $10 taxi ride will get you there. The immediate locale of the hotel is nothing special and this hotel should not be used as a base for Instanbul sightseeing. It is an airport transit hotel. We ate in the restaurant - the food was fine - it wasn't a culinary highlight, but what was served more than met our needs. Price wise, we felt that we were paying "international" prices as opposed to "turkish" prices. But, that is often the case at "airport hotels". The staff were friendly, but not always efficient. We had one instance of a staff member sending away our driver whilst we waited in the foyer. Rating this hotel was harder than usual - in some ways it deserves a "very good" based on the standard of accommodation, the room and the hotel facilities. However, I marked it down on the basis of price value. We paid a premium for both the room and the meal and by Istanbul standards it didn't represent the best of price value - however, I often find that many airport hotels fail to deliver good price value - you trade that for convenience and proximity.

Reviews.Title: “nice for stop-over in Istnabul, not more”
Reviews.Author: Goscha
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s near from airport Ataturk (5 km). Hotel provided free transfer from airport to hotel almost every half an hour (there is pause ). In the room there were all, what we need. Room was big, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was very nice. Everyone could find, what want: fresh fruits, salads, meat, cheese, scrambled eggs, omelette, baked goods, fresh honey in the comb, nuts, and muesli. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby. Good security. Everyone have to go through metal detector and to show luggage. ). Good place to stay in Istanbul if you have connecting flight there or come for business in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for airport layover”
Reviews.Author: dialright
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe that this is a Courtyard because it's better than many first line Marriotts in the USA. Very new, modern, and clean. It was our last night before heading home and perfect for a quick layover. We had an early flight and the 6am shuttle worked out very well. Note: location is pretty good in terms of the airport, though still a few mile away. Absolutely not for sightseeing in Istanbul. There was some confusion finding them. Apparently they are better known as "The Courtyard" and not so much as a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Good property let down by inflexible staff”
Reviews.Author: sm105
Reviews.Content: The property is excellent and the staff are for the most part very friendly. One caution though - beware of the internet charges. They offer two options - one for EUR 3/hr with "single login" and one for EUR 8/24 hrs with "multiple login" (sic). I chose the latter and was surprised to be hit for two charges when I checked out. The explanation was that the sign in the room "must be old" and that policy no longer applies. Despite 15 minutes of arguing and requesting a manager, they refused to budge from their position. In the end, I refused to sign the credit card slip but they went ahead and ran the charge anyway from the pre-authorisation. I have already told them that I would contest the charge when it posts and they tauntingly invited me to try. All over the grand total of EUR 8. How I can be charged twice for 24hrs worth of internet considering I was only at the property for less than 12 hours beggars belief. It is a shame that such a minor issue should spoil what was otherwise a very pleasant stay. The staff had gone out of their way to help me with other stuff prior to that, so I wouldn't even say that the service was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Buzzy1
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Platinum, and were given a top floor corner room, which was spacious with nice views (of the industrial neighborhood). Room & bathroom were clean and large, bed very comfy. Only downside was that there was a strong musty odor (or sewer gas?) that was unpleasant. Restaurant in hotel is surprisingly good (which is a plus, since nothing walkable nearby). Good shuttle service to airport, 10 minutes away. Convenience store in the hotel, and also in the gas station in front. Nowhere to walk in the neighborhood. Hotel staff excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard By Mariott Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iskowi_10
Reviews.Content: As the hotel is very close to the airport ,waiting time at check-in during peak times can be quite unnerving. Arrived in the evening after a meeting and was looking forward to get to the room but check-in took forever. Location is good and close to the airport but be aware if you plan to go out in the evening. You need to take a taxi, within 10 min. ride you can get to some very nice fish restaurants close to the sea side. There is absolut nothing close by, hotel dining is ok but not favourable. If you have a choice take the short taxi ride to a nice fish restaurant. Complimentary shuttle bus to the airport is very convient.

Reviews.Title: “Need to stay near the airport? Don't look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: Location score is based on proximity to airport - hotel is no good for Istanbul city. But if you need to be near the airport (note, it's not on the airport but a 10 minute, â‚¬5 taxi ride away, or there's a shuttle bus but that didn't seem to run too often) then don't bother searching for better. This place is about a year old, therefore totaly fresh and clean, and is great. Fantastic spa, gym, sauna etc, lovely clean, modern rooms, decent restaruant and very friendly, effificient staff. 2 great plus points for me: free wi-fi everywhere, and a large walk in shower in my room (admittedly, an upgraded exec room). No airport noise, a great night's sleep. Really, some airport hotels are dead grotty, this place would stand up for quality even in a large city centre. Can't recommend this place more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucycan
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before I booked. This is a great hotel for airport needs. The beds and rooms were very comfortable. I booked a very inexpensive rate and, as a Platinum Marriott Member, was upgraded to a nice corner room on the top floor with a free mini bar and breakfast! The food was excellent. They have a full restaurant (3 meals a day) and a bar with food. Also a small market. The pool was very nice. Great workout room. This is about a 15 min drive from the airport. As others noted, please be aware of scheduling. I was booked on the 9am and there was MASS confusion and I did finally get on a shuttle about 9:20am.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and standard are always the same - very good”
Reviews.Author: Onbizness
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, co-operative staff and it begins with the shuttle driver at the airport. The staff was very accommodating. The breakfast bar has a lot of local food items and still has the omlette station, so you can have a bit of homestyle flavor. The rooms were very clean and sufficient, as were all the other public areas visited. I really like the Courtyard experience and this one dosn't miss the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: epac25
Reviews.Content: Location is good, hotel is new and clean, but customer service is lacking. I checked in late after a flight and called from the airport to catch the next shuttle which is advertised as free. Unfortunately, the shuttles only work until midnight so I had to take a cab. I got there and checked in fairly easily. Room was nice and had a good nights rest. The problem came afterwards-- the hotel charged me for three nights when I only stayed one. Mistakes happen, but when I called to try to clear up the mistake, the agents told me that I have to wait until the night clerk came in so they can verify if I only stayed in one room for one night. I called back the next day, and they told me that the night clerk didn't come in so I would need to call back. The third time I called I was given the same story. I disputed the charges with Mastercard and hoping that this is now over-- no thanks to the Marriott. If this hotel wants to use the Marriott name they need to learn how to use their credit card machine, and they also need to learn how to solve problems when customers call with issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dxb09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this house hotel on the way home from Dubai as we had a 24hr wait in Istanbul for our connecting flight to Dublin. On arrival at the hotel it was a little alarming that there were two 6ft high perimeters fences around the hotel and that they checked the undercarriage of your taxi with mirrors for bombs! Further still on entering the hotel lobby you had to get your bags scanned and walk through metal detectors!!! Leaving that out, the staff on were very friendly. the room was very big, modern and clean. restaurant was nice. spa/pool/gym facilities also very good. hotel very convenient to airport - 10mins max from airport. I took taxi which cost approx â‚¬8. Would really recommend hotel for airport stopover.

Reviews.Title: “good airport hotel, reliable brand”
Reviews.Author: db1337
Reviews.Content: I find Marriott to be a reliable brand, you know what you will be getting in advance if you've stayed at any... This hotel is not super close to the airport, but then again no jets flying overhead. They have a shuttle going into the old town if you want to see it that way by staying here. Rooms were clean, comfortable, making it pretty much ideal for its purpose (airport stopover). Breakfast quality was good, the whole thing was efficiently run, and I would recommend it to a business traveler stopping over, or anyone arriving late at night like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stays”
Reviews.Author: ajphilly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 1 night in October 2010. The hotel is very close to the airport and it does run a shuttle. You have to pick up the shuttle from the International arrivals section of the airport. I believe the shuttle generally runs every hour on the half hour (e.g. 9:30am, 10:30am, etc.). The lobby area is a big mess and with a lot of people with luggage, it makes for a time consuming check-in process. I think we were staying in the hotel during a convention. Be sure to allow for extra time for checking-in and checking-out of the hotel. The rooms are standard Marriott quality and the food at the restaurant was expensive but good. Getting to the center of the city is a little annoying. We found it best to take the shuttle from the hotel (that leaves on the hour every hour) to the airport and then take the metro and finally switch to the tram. It sounds difficult but the entire trip takes about 45 minutes and is quite easy. Keep in mind that you will need to pay again when you switch to the tram from the metro. The cost of the metro and tram are both 1.5 Liras per person and the hotel shuttle is free. Make sure to reserve a spot on the shuttle. When coming back to the hotel after touring, we got to the airport at 9:45pm and missed the shuttle. A cab cost around 15 Lira from the airport to the hotel. They also have a shuttle that takes you to the city but when we took it there was a tremendous amount of traffic and the whole trip took us close to an hour and a half. It is much better to take public transportation. We do not recommend this hotel for long stays in Istanbul because of the annoying commute to the center of town. There appear to be no restaurants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you want to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: atcmyers
Reviews.Content: It was a little better than expected. It was very new, clean, quiet and the staff were helpful when we were there. We could not figure out how to get the shuttle from the airport so we paid for a 11 dollar Canadian taxi ride which was no big deal. The woman at the front desk gave us a very quiet room, we got help with the luggage, the wake up call came through as asked, and all the other staff were good to deal with. It is located near the airport which was exactly what we wanted. The location and area was not the best otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: Bayla1222
Reviews.Content: In a hotel, service is everything. I highly recommend not staying at this hotel. While the rooms were nice and clean, the service was absolutely horrible. Starting with zero help in guiding us iwhere to catch the shuttle at the airport, to telling us when we arrived that they can't be bothered with doing so and we should educate ourselved from their website! It's funny, we stayed in three hotels while visiting Turkey, 2 were boutiques with impeccable service and one was a U.S. chain in Instanbul (this one) where the service was atrocious and rude. When we arrived (in a cab because the shuttle never came), we were exhausted from a day of travel. There was no staff to help us with our bags so we had to push through the security entrance on our own lifting and handling with absolutely zero help. We finally got to the lobby desk and were given rude service. I asked if someone could help me print my boarding pass for an early morning flight and he said "no, our computer is broken" as he continued to check us in and print a receipt (he simply didn't want to be bothered with it). Surely there are better hotels close to the airport. I recommend you keep looking before considering staying here. One positive is that we grabbed dinner inside the hotel and our waiter was very polite. That's the best I can say.

Reviews.Title: “What a mess”
Reviews.Author: pelicanoPortugal
Reviews.Content: First i want to start by saying that we choosed this hotel for a sleepover between flights at Ataturk airport. But almost everything went bad. To start they stated that have a transfer from airport but forgot to mention that it ends at 9 pm and that only runs each hour. Then the entrance at the hotel with guys swaping the botton of the taxi and with a metal detector at the entrance it was surreal and i never have ssen something like taht before and, until day i don't understand what was the purpose. (safety it's a very, very lame excuse, sorry) The lobby was overcrowded and soon i understand why, the elevators weren't working. None of then. And they keep tell us to go from one side to the other to see if we have a lift. Completely ridiculous and not fos a hotel from this category and price. The room was the only thing we liked, with great windows and good beds. But, next morning the breakfast was anothe nightmare, with few tables, few staff membres and almost nothing to eat. A plain robbery. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stanvard
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quiet, new rooms. Free wi-fi. Convenient to Airport (10 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected for an airport hotel. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Firefool
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night on our way back from our holiday and found the hotel much better than expected. Easily spotted at a distance by the distinctive round tower. Clean, modern, good sized room with 2 double beds, flat screen TV, Wi fi., great shower and our room was very quiet. Security scanner at the door! The food at dinner was excellent and there was a good choice at breakfast. Coffee not so good in common with many establishments in Istanbul. Drinks and meals (as to be expected) a little more expensive than in town. Cozy bar. Nice swimming pool and spa. Approx 3km from Istanbul airport (15-20 min drive), convenient free comfy shuttle service, helpful, friendly staff. Seems popular with business people. Approx 45 min hair raising taxi drive (40 lira) from central Istanbul, although they also run a shuttle into town. Near an outlet type shopping centre (which we didn't try out). The complimentary water is in the fridge!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but bad check-in”
Reviews.Author: Vidalson
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel if you need to be near the airport (10 euros for the taxi max., but you can use the free shuttle, although there's only one per hour). Clean, confortable and great value for the price I paid (60 euros). The worst, the reception. Very caothic and slow (30 minuts for check in and a lot of people complaining). Breakfast poor for the price you pay, but in general, very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: brettnwau
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located for Ataturk Airport, with hte hotel providing shuttle buses to travel back and forth. Taxis cost around TL8, although it seems few taxi drivers know of the hotel. Check in fast and efficient with friendly staff. Rooms clean and reasonably spacious for the standard of the hotel. The hotel is located directly under an airport flight path, however the rooms are very well sound proofed so that there is virtually no noise. There is a "Market" available to buy drinks and snacks such as sandwiches. There is also a decent bar with happy hour in the evening. The restaurant provides reasonable quality and well priced food and drink. The hotel provides shuttles to the airport as well as to Sultanahment for the tourist attractions, providing the opportunity for some sight seeing if time allows. Overall a good hotel with a convenient location, providijng good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but far from centre”
Reviews.Author: knusper
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly and helpful. Clean, large room with all facilities you could want. Location was great for the airport, but very far (1hr+ = 30euro) from the centre of town. Quiet and clean, what more to ask!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at the airport”
Reviews.Author: Zsuzsu007
Reviews.Content: I truly recommend the Marriott Courtyard to everyone who wants to stay a bit out of the crowded center,the transportation is good easy to reach the city either with free hotel shuttle, cab or public transport. The service is absoulately relevant for a 4 star hotel alongside with very service minded staff, good level of cleaning service all around of the hotel. If you try once surley you will return back to this lovely place

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great restaurant, great staff”
Reviews.Author: enagy
Reviews.Content: Large rooms with the most confortable bed possible in a hotel. The hotel is very clean and neat. Great breakfast selection.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Istanbul International Airport
HotelInfo.Address: Fatih Caddesi, Dereboyu Sokak 2 A, Istanbul 34303, Turkey
